issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Hi All, We are trying to download an object from Walrus using GetObjectRequest API. Following are the details about the object Size: 15 bytes Name: helloworld.txt We try to use the withRange method available with AWS JAVA SDK 1.4.7 and specify a range in bytes we need to download. http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaSDK/latest/javadoc/com/amazonaws/services/s3/model/GetObjectRequest.html#withRange(long,long) Start value is 0 and End value is 15. This is 1 byte more then the actual size of the object (As its an inclusive range and start from 0, the range that would cover the entire object is 0-14). When we execute the following code on AWS {code} GetObjectRequest objectRequest = new GetObjectRequest(bucketName, "helloworld.txt"); objectRequest = objectRequest.withRange(0,15); ObjectMetadata objectMetadata = s3.getObject(objectRequest, fileToGet); {code} We get no errors, please see below {code} [java] "GET [java] [java] application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8 [java] Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:33 GMT [java] /mybucket-new/helloworld.txt" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,313] - Sending Request: GET https://s3.amazonaws.com /mybucket-new/helloworld.txt Headers: (Range: bytes=0-15, Authorization: AWS XCSE0O0MRLBI1NRDGDXN0:BbffAkBlHk1xiUTM/d6JG1PcqbM=, Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:33 GMT, User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.4.7 Linux/2.6.32-358.11.1.el6.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/23.7-b01, Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8, ) [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,314] - Get connection: HttpRoute[{s}->https://s3.amazonaws.com], timeout = 50000 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,314] - [HttpRoute[{s}->https://s3.amazonaws.com]] total kept alive: 1, total issued: 0, total allocated: 1 out of 50 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,314] - Getting free connection [HttpRoute[{s}->https://s3.amazonaws.com]][null] [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,314] - Stale connection check [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,315] - CookieSpec selected: best-match [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,315] - Auth cache not set in the context [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,315] - Attempt 1 to execute request [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,315] - Sending request: GET /mybucket-new/helloworld.txt HTTP/1.1 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "GET /mybucket-new/helloworld.txt HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "Host: s3.amazonaws.com[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "Range: bytes=0-15[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "Authorization: AWS XCSE0O0MRLBI1NRDGDXN0:BbffAkBlHk1xiUTM/d6JG1PcqbM=[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:33 GMT[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.4.7 Linux/2.6.32-358.11.1.el6.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/23.7-b01[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "Connection: Keep-Alive[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> "[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> GET /mybucket-new/helloworld.txt HTTP/1.1 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> Host: s3.amazonaws.com [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> Range: bytes=0-15 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> Authorization: AWS XCSE0O0MRLBI1NRDGDXN0:BbffAkBlHk1xiUTM/d6JG1PcqbM= [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,316] - >> Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:33 GMT [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,317] - >> User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.4.7 Linux/2.6.32-358.11.1.el6.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/23.7-b01 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,317] - >> Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,317] - >> Connection: Keep-Alive [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,375] - << "HTTP/1.1 206 Partial Content[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:34 GMT[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "Last-Modified: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:33 GMT[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "ETag: "a16b9c1433944ee3d5b5432babb7bc46"[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "Accept-Ranges: bytes[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "Content-Range: bytes 0-14/15[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "Content-Type: text/plain[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "Content-Length: 15[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "Server: AmazonS3[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,376] - << "[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - Receiving response: HTTP/1.1 206 Partial Content [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << HTTP/1.1 206 Partial Content [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:34 GMT [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << Last-Modified: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 05:49:33 GMT [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << ETag: "a16b9c1433944ee3d5b5432babb7bc46" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << Accept-Ranges: bytes [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << Content-Range: bytes 0-14/15 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << Content-Type: text/plain [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << Content-Length: 15 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,377] - << Server: AmazonS3 [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,378] - Connection can be kept alive indefinitely [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,380] - Received successful response: 206, AWS Request ID: 378D609683A7FD0D [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,380] - << "my world rocks[\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,381] - Released connection is reusable. [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,381] - Releasing connection [HttpRoute[{s}->https://s3.amazonaws.com]][null] [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,381] - Pooling connection [HttpRoute[{s}->https://s3.amazonaws.com]][null]; keep alive indefinitely [java] [2013-07-02 22:49:33,381] - Notifying no-one, there are no waiting threads {code} As can be seen no error was reported and the object was downloaded successfully at the destination. However when we execute the same code against Walrus {code} [java] "GET [java] [java] application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8 [java] Wed, 03 Jul 2013 06:06:56 GMT [java] /mybucket-new/helloworld.txt" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,107] - Sending Request: GET http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Walrus/ /mybucket-new/helloworld.txt Headers: (Range: bytes=0-15, Authorization: AWS XCSE0O0MRLBI1NRDGDXN0:aQzQN7W3oL6Sw75r+kwXX5bop0Y=, Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 06:06:56 GMT, User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.4.7 Linux/2.6.32-358.11.1.el6.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/23.7-b01, Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8, ) [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,108] - Get connection: HttpRoute[{}->http://10.104.1.210:8773], timeout = 50000 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,108] - [HttpRoute[{}->http://10.104.1.210:8773]] total kept alive: 1, total issued: 0, total allocated: 1 out of 50 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,108] - Getting free connection [HttpRoute[{}->http://10.104.1.210:8773]][null] [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,108] - Stale connection check [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,110] - CookieSpec selected: best-match [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,110] - Auth cache not set in the context [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,110] - Attempt 1 to execute request [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,110] - Sending request: GET /services/Walrus/mybucket-new/helloworld.txt HTTP/1.1 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,110] - >> "GET /services/Walrus/mybucket-new/helloworld.txt HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,111] - >> "Host: 10.104.1.210:8773[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,111] - >> "Range: bytes=0-15[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,111] - >> "Authorization: AWS XCSE0O0MRLBI1NRDGDXN0:aQzQN7W3oL6Sw75r+kwXX5bop0Y=[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,111] - >> "Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 06:06:56 GMT[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,111] - >> "User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.4.7 Linux/2.6.32-358.11.1.el6.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/23.7-b01[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,111] - >> "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> "Connection: Keep-Alive[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> "[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> GET /services/Walrus/mybucket-new/helloworld.txt HTTP/1.1 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> Host: 10.104.1.210:8773 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> Range: bytes=0-15 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> Authorization: AWS XCSE0O0MRLBI1NRDGDXN0:aQzQN7W3oL6Sw75r+kwXX5bop0Y= [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> Date: Wed, 03 Jul 2013 06:06:56 GMT [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,112] - >> User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.4.7 Linux/2.6.32-358.11.1.el6.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/23.7-b01 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,113] - >> Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,113] - >> Connection: Keep-Alive [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,176] - << "HTTP/1.1 416 Requested Range Not Satisfiable[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,176] - << "Content-Length: 328[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,177] - << "Content-Type: application/xml[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,177] - << "[\r][\n]" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,177] - Receiving response: HTTP/1.1 416 Requested Range Not Satisfiable [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,177] - << HTTP/1.1 416 Requested Range Not Satisfiable [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,177] - << Content-Length: 328 [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,177] - << Content-Type: application/xml [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,177] - Connection can be kept alive indefinitely [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,199] - << "Invalid RangeThe requested range cannot be satisfied.Range: 0-15object: mybucket-new/helloworld.txtd80d7c9a-041d-4372-9b84-90ab59dccb40" [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,206] - Released connection is reusable. [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,206] - Releasing connection [HttpRoute[{}->http://10.104.1.210:8773]][null] [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,207] - Pooling connection [HttpRoute[{}->http://10.104.1.210:8773]][null]; keep alive indefinitely [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,207] - Notifying no-one, there are no waiting threads [java] [2013-07-02 23:06:56,233] - Received error response: AmazonS3Exception: Status Code: 416, AWS Service: null, AWS Request ID: d80d7c9a-041d-4372-9b84-90ab59dccb40, AWS Error Code: Invalid Range, AWS Error Message: The requested range cannot be satisfied., S3 Extended Request ID: null [java] Error download file from the bucket [java] [java] AmazonS3Exception: Status Code: 416, AWS Service: Amazon S3, AWS Request ID: d80d7c9a-041d-4372-9b84-90ab59dccb40, AWS Error Code: Invalid Range, AWS Error Message: The requested range cannot be satisfied., S3 Extended Request ID: null [java] at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.handleErrorResponse(AmazonHttpClient.java:659) [java] at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.executeHelper(AmazonHttpClient.java:347) [java] at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.execute(AmazonHttpClient.java:199) [java] at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client.invoke(AmazonS3Client.java:2994) [java] at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client.getObject(AmazonS3Client.java:918) [java] at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client$2.getS3ObjectStream(AmazonS3Client.java:986) [java] at com.amazonaws.services.s3.internal.ServiceUtils.retryableDownloadS3ObjectToFile(ServiceUtils.java:321) [java] at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client.getObject(AmazonS3Client.java:982) [java] at AwsConsoleApp.main(Unknown Source) [java] Caught Exception: The requested range cannot be satisfied. [java] Reponse Status Code: 416 [java] Error Code: Invalid Range {code} The error is thrown as "Invalid Range" which is not similar to what we see on AWS S3. On the contrary I am not entirely sure if AWS implementation is matching the RFC 2616 , particularly this http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35 Reference: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTObjectGET.html I think our implementation matches the RFC but is not inline with S3? If you have any questions please do let me know. Cheers! Deependra
fields.summary: GetObjectRequest withRange errors when invalid range is given

comments.body: I'm seeing this same thing as well in my test code. .withRange had to be removed from my code.
here are some quick unit tests to demonstrate the breakage. Works fine when run against s3, broken when running against Walrus
unit test to validate breakage, works against S3, broken on Walrus
using the attached set of unit tests, the issue was confirmed and the fix was confirmed as well
How is this resolved when 3.3.1 is not released?
Also did the QA team ran the test against testing? I dont see any comment from QA , ping [~viglesias]

Wes is new, he doesn't know our process yet, my bad.

Wes, please put this in the In QA state and assign MattC or Vic as the
QA contact.

QA will then verify it.

On Jul 24, 2013, at 11:06 PM, "Deependra Shekhawat (JIRA)"
need to push through the correct workflow
Simple enough fix, changes and tests reviewed by Neil
Sorry, guys, n00b mistake, to make it worse, gmail pushed these messages into Spam and I didn't see them until just now. Let me know if it is still incorrect.
Verified with AWS SDK for Java.

worklogs.comment: using the attached set of unit tests, the issue was confirmed and the fix was confirmed as well
